New Records: Australia completed their biggest chase in World Cups (307/2)
Key Match Events: Mitchell Marsh finished unbeaten on 177 off 132 balls
Australia won by 8 wickets (with 32 balls remaining)
Travis Head was dismissed early in Bangladesh's innings
Mushfiqur Rahim, Mahmudullah, Towhid Hridoy, and Hridoy scored significant runs for Bangladesh
Adam Zampa claimed 22 wickets in this World Cup, moving to the top of the charts
Bangladesh posted their highest total in this World Cup (306/8)
Pre-Game Insights: Australia lost their first two games but bounced back to win seven on the trot to seal a spot in the semi-finals
Bangladesh's top seven all crossed the 20-run mark in their innings
Litton Das and Tanzid Hasan took the attack to the Australian bowlers in the powerplay
Post-Match Reflections: Mitchell Marsh expressed pride in the team's resilience after a close win
Australia will shift their focus to South Africa and the Eden Gardens
Bangladesh's defeat marks the end of a dour campaign, but they ensured they get to the Champions Trophy
Miscellaneous Highlights: Mitchell Marsh cramped up a couple of times while batting but continued to score at a brisk pace
Australia's chase of 307 was made easier by the efforts of Mitchell Marsh and David Warner
Bangladesh's highest score in this World Cup was achieved by Hridoy (74)
Adam Zampa picked two wickets to move to the top of the charts in this World Cup
Others: Rain interrupted play, reducing the game to 20 overs per side
Bangladesh's total of 306 is their highest in this World Cup
